text: Anybody done custom styles to their HubSpot blog?

Has anyone found an easy way to add an Autoprefixer to their CSS without having to copy and paste code?
Considering flex has so many prefixes :sob:
I don't believe HubSpot autoprefixes on compile, does it?

I've added macros for my main.css file but you can't use HubL in modules.

So my goal is to use the standard template and modify it to use flexbox to have all post display 4 boxes across. Iâ€™ve tried applying display: flex to multiple classes with no luck... do you have any experience with this?

I typically use my grid system underneath HubSpots. Because I think HubSpot's grid system is out of date.

So my html/hubl will include my own classes instead of HubSpots. It's more markup but I don't know anyway around it until HubSpot updates their grid system.

Here's the one I use: <http://flexboxgrid.com|flexboxgrid.com>
<@UUBS8DC95> thank you sir I appreciate it! Going to give it a try now.
